Sentencas: Long electric current transfer path has been a common problem with tubular series cells.
Titulo: To study the effect of geometric parameters on the performance of a typical cone-shaped tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: Cone-shaped tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cells (SIS-SOFCs) have attracted much attention due to their special advantages, such as short electric current path, unsealed requirement, small thermal stress, low operating electric current, and so on.
Titulo: To study the effect of geometric parameters on the performance of a typical cone-shaped tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: In this paper, the electrochemical and multiphysics coupling model of a typical SIS-SOFC is developed.
Titulo: To study the effect of geometric parameters on the performance of a typical cone-shaped tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: Then, the relationship between the geometric structure and the working characteristics within the SIS-SOFC is investigated.
Titulo: To study the effect of geometric parameters on the performance of a typical cone-shaped tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: The results show that the size of the active reaction region in the downstream coneshaped cell depends on the length of the interconnectors.
Titulo: To study the effect of geometric parameters on the performance of a typical cone-shaped tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: Thus, increasing the length of the interconnectors increases the active reaction area of the series cell while decreasing the current transmission path.
Titulo: To study the effect of geometric parameters on the performance of a typical cone-shaped tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell stack

Sentencas: The ratio between the interconnector length and total cell length equals 0.5 is found to be a proper geometric factor for the SIS-SOFC to achieve a good overall performance and reaction uniformity.
Titulo: To study the effect of geometric parameters on the performance of a typical cone-shaped tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell stack
